page.title: 01The Village of Langtoft
page.content: Langtoft is a small village situated in the Yorkshire Wolds.It is in the county of Humberside,the Borough of East Yorkshire,and the Parliamentary Constituency of Bridlington.It lies on the B1249 road between Driffield and Scarborough. There are 318 people in the village. The landscape is of high rolling hills with steep sided valleys,locally called dales,which are used for grazing sheep.Most of the land is intensively farmed producing arable crops although there are some dairy herds and intensive pig units. The village has a Primary School,a Post Office,two small shops,a Church, a Methodist Chapel,a Public House,an Agricultural Suppliers,a coach company,an Undertaker and a firm that fits hand controls for disabled drivers.
